content.question: Which of the following equations best represents the reacting species in the reaction between <math alttext="Z n" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Z</mtext><mtext>n</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> metal and <math alttext="N i C l 2, aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>N</mtext><mtext>i</mtext><mtext>C</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>l</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="Z n, solid, plus N i C l 2, aqueous, react to produce Z n with a positive 2 charge, aqueous, plus N i, solid, plus 2 C l with a negative 1 charge, aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>Zn</mi><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>s</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>NiCl</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded><mo>→</mo><msup><mi>Zn</mi><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded><mo>+</mo><mi>Ni</mi><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>s</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><msup><mi>Cl</mi><mo>-</mo></msup><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math>

<math alttext="Z n, solid, plus N i C l 2, aqueous, react to produce Z n C l 2, aqueous, plus N i with a positive 2 charge, aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Z</mtext><mtext>n</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mo>+</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>N</mtext><mtext>i</mtext><mtext>C</mtext><msub><mtext>l</mtext><mn>2</mn></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mo>→</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>Z</mtext><mtext>n</mtext><mtext>C</mtext><msub><mtext>l</mtext><mn>2</mn></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mo>+</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>N</mtext><msup><mtext>i</mtext><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>

<math alttext="Z n with a positive 2 charge, aqueous, plus N i, solid, react to produce Z n, solid, plus N i positive 2 charge, aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Z</mtext><msup><mrow><mtext>n</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mo>+</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>N</mtext><mtext>i</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mo>→</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>Z</mtext><mtext>n</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mo>+</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>N</mtext><msup><mrow><mtext>i</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 5.E: Determine a balanced chemical equation for a given chemical phenomenon.
